item.title: HEARTHS AND EMBERS
item.description: People with spiked Prism aptitudes. The cost of power is life. Embers suffer a shortened lifespan, burning their years away the moment this flame blooms within them for the first time. Despite that, it's a gift, one that manifests randomly and powerfully, and comes at a horrid price. Players are called Embers, groups of bonded Embers are called Hearths. This bond acts as a "Resonance Buffer," preventing the individuals from "detonating" or collapsing into a Hollow state. Hearths can form due to: Rituals done by the Embers themselves, or even without the Embers' choice/knowledge via grimoires or other artifacts. Life experiences: a Bond is likely to form during a shared traumatic event, or, for the lucky ones, it can build up after years of closeness with one another. Bonding with other Embers allows for cleaner channelling - which translates nicely into extra energy per party member. Because Embers forget their pasts (due to LORE/WORLD/RELIGION-PHILOSOPHY/EROSION), they often lack a traditional moral compass. They act on instinct, immediate survival, or the orders of whoever is currently guiding them.

item.title: CINDERS
item.description: Just as there are the Hearthbonded Embers, there are also "stray Embers", or "Cinders". Embers without a Hearth, either because of tragedy, or neglect, they suffer alone. These individuals are a lore thing mostly, meaning - unplayable, and make for great adversaries. Ranging from "Mad geniuses" who "made it work", to individuals broken by trauma, lashing out at the unjust world. If bonding is so necessary, how do solo adversaries survive? They consume others. A Cinder doesn't have their Hearth; they seek Fuel. They kidnap low-aptitude people and "burn" through them to stabilize their own LORE/WORLD/RELIGION-PHILOSOPHY/EROSION. This gives the players a clear, gritty objective: stop the Cinder from using the local village as a life support.

item.title: RULINGS
item.description: Enemies operate on fixed values and unique behaviours, ignoring player Prism constraints. This allows the GM to create "impossible" threats that require specific card or behaviour answers. An enemy's "Statblock" is essentially their Intent Loop/Algorithm + their HP. Ex.: Husk - 7 HP Intent: Strike (6) -> Guard (8) -> Strike (8) -> Guard (12) -> LOOP. This makes enemies predictable (rewards knowledge/experience and learning), and decreases GM's mental load drastically, while keeping the players on their toes whenever they meet something new.

item.title: TURNS
INVENTORY
item.description:
Inventory is strictly divided to separate narrative utility from mechanical progression. Tools (~3 Slots): Functional items (Rope, Flint/Steel, Chalk, Medicine). These grant Advantage (+1 Success) on specific BS ROLLS (CHECKS). Gatekeeping: Certain tasks (climbing a sheer cliff) are impossible (DC ) without the specific item (Rope). Curios (~3 Slots): Personal narrative items or unique trophies. These have zero mechanical weight and exist solely for character flavour or specific narrative purposes. Shards (Numerical Value): Weightless essence stored directly in the Ember’s resonance. Coin Pouch: Traditional currency used for mundane trade (food, lodging, information).
Armaments (Swords, Staves, Plate) are Narrative Justifications. They do not occupy slots because they are the physical justification of your 10-card deck. A player doesn't "get a sword" for +1 DMG; they have Strike cards because they have a sword.
These are rare, non-consumable items that sit on the Hearth Sheet (Alongside VITALS, ENERGY, etc.).
They provide non-Oath Passives to the Hearth, but have either low number values, or specific conditions to make them click. Examples would Include: The Stone Heart: The Hearth is immune to the first Yellow (Disruptive) Intent of every combat.
The Whispering Coil: When the Sync-Axis is in Harmony (+3 SYNC-AXIS), Mend effects are doubled.
Heavy Greataxe: Adds Pierce to the first Strike each turn.
The Hearth can carry 3 Artifacts (Active Passives) and 6 Mundane Items (Tools/Curios). Shards do not count toward this limit; they are stored within the "Ember" itself.

item.title: BURSTS
item.description: Reduce the cost of all cards currently dealt to 1 this turn. Next card played this turn takes effect 2 extra times (so 3 activations total). Stun an enemy. (Pause their Intent) Draw Guile cards, regain 1 ENERGY.

item.title: VIBE
item.description: Low fantasy: magic is ubiquitous but weakened. People usually know someone who uses it for something more, but almost nobody can use it Well - in a controlled manner, while retaining power. Most common folk have a hard time with just one of these dimensions. Anyone can light a torch with a flick of their fingers, but someone with enough aptitude and strength to cast a ray of fire is one in a million. Dark Fantasy: The world is undoubtably a "Bad Place to Be in". People assume the worst in people, The weather usually sucks, and it is dangerous "out there" even for Embers. The environment is hostile, often shrouded in the GREY MIST, making travel suicidal without the light of a Hearth. Gritty: The players are not expected to be "heroes in shining armours, come to save the world". They can be, of course, if they will it, but morally grey and even antagonistic options are on the table still.

item.title: MIGHT
item.description: Physical force, momentum, and brute-force attrition. Keywords: Strike, Empower, Merciless, Pierce (Brute), Discard.

item.title: INSIGHT
item.description: Tactical manipulation, force multiplication, and metaphysical stability. Keywords: Focus, Ward, Ignite, Lightning, Mend.

item.title: GUILE
item.description: Precision, resource management, and reactive defense. Keywords: Guard, BRACE, Counter, Bleed, Pierce (Precision), Draw.

item.title: VITALS
item.description:
This is the Sum of All Players' Prisms + [N (no. Players) X 2] When Vitals hits 0, the deck's top card is flipped, and the owner must decide: Burden: Add 2 STATUS cards to the shared deck. These last between combats until cleared.
Shatter: Permanently remove 1 of the CUSTOMS of their choice from the pool. Trauma: A player permanently reduces one Prism by 1.

item.title: PASSIVES
item.description:
Dealing unblocked HP damage grants +1 Burst Charge. Negate the first negative STATUS applied to the Hearth each combat.
Start combats with Guile Brace/Empower.
Killing an enemy draws 1 Card OR grants 1 ENERGY.

item.title: OATH_OF_THE_MISTWALKER
item.description:
Your Prism scores are as follows: 1 Might
2 Guile
0 Insight You may allocate a single point to a chosen Prism. Your Starting deck consists of:
3x Strike
5x Guard
2x Counter

item.title: PASSIVES
item.description:
Regain Might VITALS at combat end.
If a STRIKE kills an enemy, all excess damage is applied to a random target.
Might-based discards for Burst charges grant +3 instead of +2.
Whenever the Hearth takes VITALS damage, gain +1 Burst Charge.

item.title: OATH_OF_THE_CRUCIBLE
item.description:
Your Prism scores are as follows: 2 Might
1 Guile
0 Insight You may allocate a single point to a chosen Prism. Your Starting deck consists of: Either;
6x Strike
4x Guard Or;
6x Guard
4x Strike

item.title: BURSTS
item.description:
Double current Empower/BRACE stacks.
Gain 2 X Might X GUARD.
Strike with Empower multiplier (DMG = Strike X Empower, instead of Strike + 1).
Mend Half Max HP, grant Might Burst charges to another Ember.

item.title: PASSIVES
item.description:
When you trigger an ECHO keyword, the values are set to 2 (usually 1).
Your IGNITE effects deal damage at the start of the enemy's turn.
Allies can use your INSIGHT if its higher than theirs, when playing an INSIGHT-scaling card.
FOCUS INSIGHT the first card played each turn.

item.title: OATH_OF_THE_CONDUIT
item.description:
Your Prism scores are as follows: 0 MIGHT
1 GUILE
2 INSIGHT You may allocate a single point to a chosen Prism. Your Starting deck consists of:
3x STRIKE
3x GUARD And,
4x FOCUS Or;
4x MEND

item.title: BURSTS
item.description:
Enemy loses all GUARD and COUNTER.
STRIKE LIGHTNING BLEED/IGNITE.
Play up to INSIGHT cards for free, if they scale with INSIGHT (from other players too).
IGNITE 2 AREA (Enemies). Already IGNITE enemies take their total IGNITE stacks as DMG immediately.

item.title: CUSTOMS
item.description:
Custom Cards have more than One Keyword. Can be UNIQUE or upgraded from BACKBONE cards.
Card ENERGY Cost Scales with Keyword count (1:1), making complex cards more expensive to play.
They use only the related Prism's Value for effects, where applicable, without the BACKBONE reliability bonus.

item.title: BACKBONE
item.description: Starter Cards with only One Keyword, they have an innate +3 Value. Backbone cards are limited to the single-keyword cards provided in the Starting Oath Deck. Adding any keyword or modifying them turns them into Custom cards, removing the +3 bonus. Likewise, removing extra Keywords from a CUSTOMS card brings it back to a Backbone once its left with just One Keyword. Deck Rule: A player’s deck must always contain at least 4 Backbone Cards.

item.title: VAMPIRIC
item.description: Heal party for 1/4th Value.

item.title: PIERCE
item.description: Ignores Block. Uses the higher Prism Value. Scales with MIGHT OR GUILE, whichever's higher.

item.title: WARD
item.description: Negates the next negative STATUS or Keyword applied by an enemy. Stacks.

item.title: SHARDS
item.description:
Shards are the universal currency of the Hearth. They act as both long-term progression and "Crushable" mid-combat consumables: Cost: 0 ENERGY.
Effect: Add one Secondary Non-Scaling Keyword (AREA DELAY DISCARD DRAW ECHO LIGHTNING PIERCE RETAIN VAMPIRIC.) to the next card played, OR
grant +1 ENERGY / +1 Card / 1 DMG. Crushed Shards are gone forever and cannot be used for progression.

item.title: LEVEL_UP
item.description:
Level-Ups occur during rests/between session, and, through SHARDS accumulated during travels allow for: Increasing a single Prism's Value (-5)
Removing Cards (-3) *A player’s deck must always contain at least 4 BACKBONE Cards. Adding Keywords to Cards (-3)
Purging STATUS cards (-3)
Adding new BACKBONE Cards (-2) Changing Keywords already on Cards (-2) Removing Keywords from Cards (+1)

item.title: BS ROLLS (CHECKS)
item.description: Used to resolve arguments or environmental obstacles. Pool: 2d6 Base + Prism X d6. Success: Each die showing 4, 5, or 6. Sixes count double. Failure: Each die showing 3, 2, or 1. Ones count double. Difficulty: DC 1-2: Standard task. DC 3: Strenuous. DC 4: Dangerous/Elite. DC 6+: Near-impossible.

item.title: BURST
item.description:
Each player has an individual Ember Gauge (0-10). Charging: Play: +1 Charge per 1 ENERGY spent on your cards.
Sacrifice: +2 Charges per 1 ENERGY cost of a card willingly discarded from hand. Activation:
Costs 10 Charges and 2 ENERGY. Burst-Lock: Only one player can trigger a Burst per turn, and the Bursting Ember cannot generate Burst Charges on the turn they used their Burst. * Additionally, when drawing cards, the player that Bursted is excluded from the calculation (N x 3) for that turn.

item.title: OWNER_PRIORITY
item.description: To prevent Alpha-gaming, the player who owns the card currently being played has Absolute Veto. They decide the targets, the timing, and whether to discard it for Burst charges. Negotiation is encouraged, but the Owner's word is law.

item.title: SYNC-AXIS
item.description: The relationship between Embers dictates the combat playstyle. The scale ranges from -3 to +3, and is tied to ENERGY and DMG variables. | Level | State | Combat Bonus | Combat Penalty | |---|---|---|---| | +3 | Harmony | +3 Shared Energy per turn. | Take +1 incoming damage. | | +2 | Bonded | +2 Shared Energy per turn. | Take Full incoming damage. | | +1 | Aligned | +1 Shared Energy per turn. | Take Full incoming damage. | | 0 | Indifferent | No bonus energy. | No damage mitigation. | | -1 | Friction | 0 Bonus Energy. | Buffer: -1 DMG from all incoming hits. | | -2 | Distant | 0 Bonus Energy. | Buffer: -2 DMG from all incoming hits. | | -3 | Discord | -1 Max Energy. | Buffer: -3 DMG from all incoming hits. |

item.title: ENERGY
item.description: Used to play cards. The cost of a card equals the number of Keywords on it (Min. 1). A Party's Energy Max is calculated as follows: N (no. Players) X 2

item.title: RETAIN
item.description: Card stays in hand if unplayed.

item.title: MERCILESS
item.description: If target has 0 Block, add Value to DMG. Scales with MIGHT

item.title: LIGHTNING
item.description: Hits two random targets (or one target twice if its the only one available).

item.title: IGNITE
item.description: Deal Value DMG at the end of the turn, then decrease stacks by 1. Scales with INSIGHT

item.title: ECHO
item.description: Retrigger previous card (with a matching Primary) with all values set to 1.

item.title: DRAW
item.description: Draw X cards.

item.title: DISCARD
item.description: Discard X cards.

item.title: DELAY
item.description: Card takes effect at the start of next turn.

item.title: BLEED
item.description: Deal Value DMG again at the end of enemy's turn, once. Scales with GUILE

item.title: AREA
item.description: Affects ALL enemies, or ALL allies.

item.title: STRIKE
item.description: Deal Value DMG. Scales with MIGHT

item.title: MEND
item.description: Restores Value Vitality. Scales with INSIGHT

item.title: GUARD
item.description: Grants Value Block. Scales with GUILE

item.title: FOCUS
item.description: Adds Value to the numeric effect of the next card played. Scales with INSIGHT

item.title: EMPOWER
item.description: Pool of Value. Increases DMG by 1 per hit; pool decreases by 1 per hit. Scales with MIGHT

item.title: COUNTER
item.description: Grants Value stacks. Deals Value DMG back when hit; halve stacks (round up) after each trigger. Scales with GUILE

item.title: BRACE
item.description: Pool of Value. Increases Block efficiency by 1; pool decreases by 1 when HP damage is taken. Scales with GUILE

item.title: UNIQUE
item.description: Unique Cards are ones gained through Backstory, or Campaign Events, usually crafted by the GM.
